column1: end_of_the_UK_title;The end of the United Kingdom;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_the_UK_desc;With both Scotland and Ireland gone
column2: this Kingdom can't be called 'United' anymore. Long live England!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: end_of_transcaucasia_ARM_desc;The Transcaucasian union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_transcaucasia_AZB_desc;The Transcaucasian union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_transcaucasia_GEO_desc;The Transcaucasian union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_albania_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_bosnia_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_bulgaria_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_croatia_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_greece_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_montenegro_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_serbia_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_yugoslavia_slovenia_desc;The Slavic union has been sundered. It is time to bring it to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_the_war;End the War;La Guerre Doit Finir;Der Krieg Muss Beenden;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
end_the_war_desc;Our enemy is defeated. The people call out for us to end the war
column2: even if we don't get everything we intended.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: english_cw_mod_desc;Our Parliament is growing increasingly contemptuous and distrustful of our King's absolute regime.;;;;;;x;;
english_parliarebels_desc;These rebels want to assert the power of the English parliament over the King.;;;;;;x;;
entre_rios_independent_desc;General Francisco Ramírez has issued a call to the people of Argentina: rise up
column2: and force the dictators to agree to a just constitution that provides rights to every Argentine citizen!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: establish_a_constitution_desc;It is time to establish a modern constitution for our nation
column2: distinct from our British colonial past. It shall also be an opportunity to attempt to unite our divided population. ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: establish_a_modern_capital_desc;The time has come for us to establish Islamabad as a new and modern capital for our nation. Karachi is vulnerable to attack from the coast and it's infrastructure has become strained by it's burgeoning population. Islamabad's more central location will also serve to further unite our geographically divided population. ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

establish_panslavism_desc;The Orthodox Christians of the Balkans have lived under the boot of Muslim oppression for too long. The time has come to call on them to rise up against their oppressors. All Yugoslavia must unite!;;;;;;;;;;;;x
eth_mission_to_cairo_desc;The strained relations between Ethiopia and Egypt must come to an end. We each have our respective lands
column2: and truly there is no reason for us to fight. At worst
column3: continued conflict will leave both our nations weak to exploitation by foreign powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: europe_immigration_postwar_desc;With anti-colonial feelings ever increasing the chance that we'll lose our place in the world is becoming very likely. However
column2: while we may not be able to maintain control over our empire
column3: perhaps we can bring our empire to us through immigration and by doing so remain a major power?;;;;;;x

column1: europe_immigration_stop_desc;Many $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens are starting to feel like a minority in their own country
column2: perhaps it would be best to increase immigration control.;;;;;;x

column1: Europeoverview_DESC;Europe is split into two alliances
column2: the Central Powers and the Triple Entente. The Central Powers center around the German Empire. Germany and Austria-Hungary formed the Dual Alliance in 1879
column3: to combat the threat of a French or Russian attack. Italy was added to the alliance in 1882. It was intended to be a defensive alliance only. These three countries form the Central Powers. But
column4: Italy has claims on some of Austria-Hungary's land
column5: so if war happens
column6: their allegance will not be certain. Russia and France formed an alliance in 1887
column7: to counterbalance the Central Powers. When Britain signed on in 1907
column8: it was the end of their neutrality in Europe. This was partially because of Germany's growing naval power
column9: which could threaten British naval supremacy. Those countries make up the Triple Entente;États-Unis;USA;;EE UU;;;;;;;;;x

column1: europe_postwar_immigration_desc;We have opened our doors to immigrants from our former colonies.;;;;;;x
Europewarfever_desc;The people of Europe are getting riled up for war
column2: ready to avenge their ancestors and take back what is rightfully theirs.;États-Unis;USA;;EE UU;;;;;;;;;x

column1: Europewarfever_1;So our people are more interested in war. hmm...;États-Unis;USA;;EE UU;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC10004;A new ideology based on the the islamic religion has surfaced. Frustrated by colonial occupation and driven to zeal by the lack of access to basic needs
column2: many muslims are now turning to islamism. This ideology has for goal the establishment of a fundamentalist society based entirely on a strict religious code known as 'Sharia law';;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC21600; Sir! Cumbre Vieja has erupted and caused a massive landslide which in turn created the biggest wave ever recorded in human history! Those living in the Canary Islands didn't stand a chance! It is now headed directly towards Europe and North America!;;;;;;x
EVTDESC21700; Twisters have wrecked havok in the province and as a result many residents have lost their homes and businesses. The local economy will most likely take a few months to recover.;;;;;;x

EVTDESC95500;The colonial powers of the world have gathered in $CAPITAL$ to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. The outcome has become known as the 'General Act of the $CAPITAL$ Conference'
column2: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column3: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95501;A conference has been held in $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: attended by all colonial powers
column3: to discuss the regulation of colonization and trade in Africa. A general agreement has been reached
column4: formalizing the scramble for the African continent. After this point
column5: any civilized country will largely be seen as justified in aggression towards uncivilized African nations.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95505;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt throughout Africa
column2: and some members of the government are suggesting we should press for more direct control over native African governments. Without $COUNTRY_ADJ$ protection
column3: it's very likely that these people would fall under the sway of a competing colonial power
column4: and is it not our moral imperative to extend the benefits that true civilization can offer?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95506;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence is felt everywhere in $COUNTRY$. They come to us
column2: saying they will bring education and civilization. We know what they really want: all the wealth of $COUNTRY$ in their coffers. But what can we do? Now they wish to govern us more directly-- for our 'protection' from other ambitious foreign powers. If we agree
column3: our way of life is over. If we refuse
column4: they will make war upon us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95507;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ people have made a foolhardy decision: they have refused our offer of protection and have gone so far as to eject our representatives from the country. There are even reports of several deaths. It seems we are left with no choice but to march into $FROMCOUNTRY$ and force them to see the proper path.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96000;War is Upon Us;La Guerre c'est Ici;Der Krieg Kommt;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96000;$COUNTRY$ is in a state of total war with one of the Great Powers of the world. In a modern age where warfare has the capability of killing millions
column2: the very future of our nation could be at stake. The call has gone out to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: put aside your petty differences
column3: your day-to-day lives and your personal ambitions. $COUNTRY$ must pull together in this, our hour of need!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96000;We shall be victorious!;Nous serons victorieux!;Wir sind siegreich!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96010;The Treaty of $CAPITAL$;Le Traité de $CAPITAL$;Der Vertrag von $CAPITAL$;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and like vultures the victors have descended upon us. We have been forced to the bargaining table to accept humiliating terms regarding the breakup of our empire
column3: with many of our lands simply given away
column4: and we shall be permitted no overseas holdings whatsoever. This is a moment that shall be remembered in $COUNTRY$ for years to come.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96004;The Demands of War;Les Demandes de la Guerre;Die Nachfragen des Krieges;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC96004;The constant state of war $COUNTRY$ is under has taken its toll on our people. Shortages of basic goods and the failure to deliver swift victory have worn down the enthusiasm with which the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people initially greeted the war effort. If things don't turn around soon
column2: we could face growing weariness and unrest within our own borders.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96004;We will win this war!;Nous gagnerons la guerre!;Wir gewinnen den Krieg!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96005;Is It All For Nothing?;Est-il Tout Pour Rien?;Ist Alles Für Nichts?;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96005;Growing demonstrations in $CAPITAL$ demonstrate the prevailing attitude of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people: get us out of the war
column2: and soon. Too many have been lost
column3: too many sacrifices made
column4: and all for what? The people wish to go back to their regular lives
column5: without the constant spectre of war hanging over their heads.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96005;Do not lose hope!;Ne perdez pas l'espoir!;Verlieren Sie nicht Hoffnung!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96006;The war effort is not going well
column2: to put it lightly. Advisors are saying that $COUNTRY$ should sue for peace
column3: do whatever it takes to end this war before something even more terrible happens. The people are on the brink of revolt. We must act!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96010;We welcome peace;La paix est bienvenue;Frieden ist willkommen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96013;The Breakup of $FROMCOUNTRY$;La Dissolution de $FROMCOUNTRY$;Das Auseinanderbrechen von $FROMCOUNTRY$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96013;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war
column2: and we have been invited to the negotiating table to discuss the potential breakup of their empire. This could potentially mean we see $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands returned to us
column3: though if we forego our claims it could mean salvaging a relationship with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96013;We will attend the talks;Nous joindrons les entretiens;Wir gehen zu den Gesprächen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96013;We will not attend;Nous n'irons pas;Wir gehen nicht;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96014;The Breakup of $FROMCOUNTRY$;La Dissolution de $FROMCOUNTRY$;Das Auseinanderbrechen von $FROMCOUNTRY$;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96014;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been forced to concede defeat in its war
column2: and now treaty talks have begun to discuss the breakup of their empire. As an enemy of $FROMCOUNTRY$
column3: our place at the table is assured. At the very least
column4: any $COUNTRY_ADJ$ lands currently in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ possession should be returned.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96014;We simply wish our lands back;Nous voulons nos terres;Wir wünschen unsere Länder;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96015;The defeat of $FROMCOUNTRY$ in their war has forced them to the negotiating table
column2: and one of the terms for the breakup of their empire is our release from their direct rule. This would mean casting out $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials and potentially turning them into an enemy. We could maintain our close ties with $FROMCOUNTRY$ even with our freedom
column3: though this would mean passing up a chance for freedom and goodwill from $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96015;$COUNTRY$ shall be free;$COUNTRY$ sera libre;$COUNTRY$ ist frei;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96015;$FROMCOUNTRY$ is our ally;$FROMCOUNTRY$ est notre allié;$FROMCOUNTRY$ ist unser Verbündetes;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96016;One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. They should not be allowed to keep these lands
column2: but determinining how they should be disposed of is no simple matter. For now
column3: agreement has been reached determining some of the territory
column4: and any remaining will have to be negotiated over in the coming year.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96016;We will take what we can;Nous voulons autant que possible;Wir wünschen so viel wie möglich;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96016;Our only interest is limiting $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ power;Nous voulons seulement;Wir wünschen nur wenig;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC96016;We have no interest in their colonies;Nous ne voulons pas les colonies;Wir wünschen nicht die Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96017;One of the matters discussed at the treaty talks is what to do with $FROMCOUNTRY$'s colonial holdings. We are not a great power
column2: and it's possible that even if pursue some of their colonies for our own we'll end up with nothing... but if we do not try
column3: we'll end up with nothing for sure. Even so
column4: making the attempt could be seen as aggressive.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96020;The War is Over;La Guerre c'est Finie;Der Krieg ist Fertig;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have taken to the streets of $CAPITAL$ in celebration. The toll of the war has been heavy
column3: but today $COUNTRY$ is simply happy to be at peace.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96022;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has been created from the ether
column2: but the powers-that-be have determined at least some of their lands rightfully belong to $COUNTRY$ and should be returned to us. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have rejoiced at this news.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96025;Enemy of my Enemy;Ennemi de mon Ennemi;Feind meines Feindes;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96025;Now that we are in a state of total war
column2: the idea has arisen that $COUNTRY$ should approach $FROMCOUNTRY$'s enemies to see if there are those who would join our side against them. This may mean an unholy alliance with those who might never fight at our side otherwise
column3: but as the old saying goes: 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend.' If we are to win the war against $FROMCOUNTRY$
column4: we may have to take that to heart.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB96025;We don't need more allies;Nous n'avons pas besoin de plus d'alliés;Wir benötigen nicht mehr Verbündete;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96030;The Shadow of War;L'ombre de la Guerre;Der Schatten des Krieges;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96030;A diplomat from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has approached us with a proposal: an alliance with them
column2: to fight in a war against their enemy... who is certainly no friend of ours. While the alliance does not necessarily obligate us
column3: the question really remains whether or not $COUNTRY$ even wishes to go to war. If we fight with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column4: we stand the chance of gaining the spoils of war for ourselves. It also means we could fall with them. The choice is ours.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96030;We will ally with $FROMCOUNTRY$;Nous convenons;Wir stimmen zu;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96031;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Agreed;$FROMCOUNTRY$ a Convenu;$FROMCOUNTRY$ hat Zugestimmt;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC96031;We have received word from $FROMCOUNTRY$ that they have agreed to an alliance. Whether or not they will actually live up to that alliance and join us in the war remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96065;A diplomatic incident with one of our enemies has outraged $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens. Several weeks ago
column2: an envoy assigned to $CAPITAL$ was accused of stealing national secrets. It turned out the truth was far worse
column3: and an investigation has unearthed a conspiracy to destablize $COUNTRY$ and leave it week for invasion. This has leaked out to the public
column4: and now crowds in the capital are calling for total war.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: no matter the cost.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB96065;We cannot afford such a war.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96066;The assassination of a prominent $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizen by a dissident has
column2: after a thorough investigation
column3: turned out to be at the instigation of an enemy power. This is but the latest in a string of incidents designed to destabilize $COUNTRY$. The results of the investigation have leaked to the public
column4: and massive crowds gathered in the streets of $CAPITAL$ are now calling for total war.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: our colonies and overseas territories must be surrendered. Negotiations are currently underway as to which nations they will be 'assigned' to. It appears our humiliation is not yet complete.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96070;Time to carve up our empire.;Nous n'avons aucun choix.;Wir haben keine Wahl.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96071;Transfer of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Colonies;Les Colonies $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$;Das $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Kolonien;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96071;Negotiations are still underway as to which countries will obtain control over the remaining $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies and overseas territories.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA96071;We will accept control over the colony.;Nous acceptons.;Wir nehmen an.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB96071;We do not wish any more colonies.;Nous refusons.;Wir lehnen ab.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96081;An isolated $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory has been offered to us. We should consider whether we wish to adminster it
column2: as accessing the land may be difficult according to current borders. But
column3: then again
column4: do we truly wish $FROMCOUNTRY$ to keep it?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96085;The New $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government;Le Nouveau Gouvernement $COUNTRY_ADJ$;Die Neue $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Regierung;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96085;As the armies of our former enemy depart $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed democratic government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ question whether 'freedom' imposed by a foreign power is truly that.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96085;We welcome the new regime.;Nous faisons bon accueil au nouveau régime.;Wir begrüßen das neue Regime.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96086;As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed fascist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96087;As the armies of our former enemy leave $CAPITAL$
column2: they leave behind a newly-installed communist government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown
column3: but many within $COUNTRY$ seem already determined to overthrow it in the name of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96090;With the loss of $COUNTRY$ in the recent war
column2: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy has received much of the blame-- there have already been several assassination attempts
column3: and calls within the government for the monarchy to step down. Sentiment in the public has turned to the notion of $COUNTRY$ becoming a democracy... though some fear this will plunge the nation into even further chaos.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME96130;The Price of Infamy;Le Prix de l'Infamie;Der Preis der Niedertracht;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96130;There are rumblings in the international community regarding $COUNTRY$'s warlike demeanor
column2: and some are talking about the need for a united front to contain $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aggression. There are even efforts to stir up our own citizens against us. We will have to be careful in the future
column3: lest we face not a single enemy but that of the world's great powers united against us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96130;Just let them try it!;Laissez-les Venir!;Lassen Sie Kommen!;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96131;An Ease in Tensions;Un Amoindrissement des Tensions;Eine Verminderung von Spannungen;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96131;The world's great powers have taken note of $COUNTRY$'s efforts to change our aggressive ways. Some are making overtures to improve relations
column2: and their diplomats are expressing hope that $COUNTRY$ will continue to deal with other countries in a civilized manner.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96131;Thanks for the vote of confidence.;Merci pour le vote de confiance.;Dank für die Vertrauensabstimmung.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96136;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached our nation with an ultimatum: dimantle $COUNTRY$ immediately
column2:
or the great powers of the world will be forced to unite against us. Their demands consist of the following:

1. The return of all unlawfully-held territories gained by conquest.
2. The release of any aspirant peoples currently within our lands.
3. The transfer of all colonies and overseas territories to the other great powers.
4. An agreement by $COUNTRY$ not to declare war on any other nation for a period of no less than ten years.

It goes without saying that these demands are extremely humiliating
column3: and the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people would be justifiably upset should we agree. If we do not
column4: however
column5: $COUNTRY$ will face a great war which even we may not be able to deal with.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB96136;We have no choice but to accept.;Nous acceptons.;Wir nehmen an.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96141;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Joins the War;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Déclare la Guerre;$FROMCOUNTRY$ Erklärt Krieg;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96141;We have received a cable from $FROMCOUNTRY$: they have declared war upon us
column2: and will pursue the war until such a time as $COUNTRY$ is disarmed and submitted to the will of the international community.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA96141;We shall see about that.;Je doute de lui.;Ich bezweifele es.;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME96150;$COUNTRY$ Stands Triumphant;$COUNTRY$ est Triomphante;$COUNTRY$ ist Triumphierend;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96150;We have proven that no nation can stand in $COUNTRY$'s way. We will do as we please
column2: and no amount of objection from the so-called great powers of the world will deter us from achieving our destiny. For now there is peace
column3: and if other nations seek to stop us from achieving our future goals
column4: they are welcome to try.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96006_NEWS_LONG;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well
column2: to say the least.  Much of the country is under enemy occupation
column3: and the populace even in the free areas is suffering greatly from massive shortages. Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peacedo whatever it takes to end this war
column4: and end it now. This is a dark day for $COUNTRY$
column5:  said one official. We are beyond a state of emergency. The situation is simply hopeless for us. If our allies do not come to our aid soon
column6: we are lost.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96006_NEWS_MEDIUM;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well
column2: to say the least.  Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peacedo whatever it takes to end this war
column3: and end it now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96006_NEWS_SHORT;Reports from $COUNTRY$ indicate that their effort in the Great War is not going well. Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are urging that their leaders sue for peace.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC96010_NEWS_LONG;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that a treaty had been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. $COUNTRY$ will be dismantled
column3:  one official relayed. Their sins shall be forgiven
column4: but in return they will give up all their colonial holdings
column5: shall release any sovereign states within their borders and return any foreign lands under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ occupation. We seek to ensure that $COUNTRY$ is in no way able to threaten world peace once more.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96010_NEWS_MEDIUM;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that an accord had finally been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column3: resulting in the dismantling of $COUNTRY$ and all its holdings.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96010_NEWS_SHORT;After much deliberation following the end of the recent war
column2: delegates left $CAPITAL$ with the announcement that a peace treaty had finally been reached with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stayat least for the time being. While not everyone in $COUNTRY$ is thrilled at the idea of their freedom being imposed on them by an enemy country
column3: many are nevertheless overjoyed. I do not care if $COUNTRY_ADJ$ democracy comes only because $FROMCOUNTRY$ tells us to do it
column4:  one citizen gushed. What matters is that now I can vote.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stayat least for the time being. While not everyone in $COUNTRY$ is thrilled at the idea of their freedom being imposed
column3: many are nevertheless overjoyed.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC96085_NEWS_SHORT;With elections already underway in $COUNTRY$, it has become clear that the $FROMCOUNTRY$-supported democratic government is here to stayat least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere. Efforts are already underway to suppress any resistance from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column5: and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ flags hang in every window beside $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ones. They are our allies
column6:  said one man. Why would we not honor what they have done for us?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported government already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that fascism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism  in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere. Efforts are already underway to suppress any resistance from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column5: and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ flags hang in every window beside $COUNTRY_ADJ$ ones. They are our allies
column6:  said one man. Why would we not honor what they have done for us?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers may have left $COUNTRY$
column4: but their presence is still felt everywhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$-supported politburo already assembling in $CAPITAL$
column3: it is clear that communism in $COUNTRY$ is here to stayat least for the time being.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Sakoku was the foreign relations policy of Japan instituted by the Tokugawa shogunate in the 17th century
column3: with no foreigner allowed to enter the country on pain of death. While some contact with westerners was permitted in the south
column4: at the Dejima trade enclave in particular
column5: such contact was strictly regulated and kept Japan in a state of isolation from the rest of the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Rangaku referred to the body of knowledge developed by Japan through its contacts with the Dutch enclave at Dejima. Despite the enforced isolation of the nation
column3: this policy of learning allowed western influences to spread-- particularly in the southern domains of Satsuma and Choshu.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97606;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with a treaty in hand: we have gained numerous trade concessions
column2: but more importantly we have cracked open the shield that is Japan's policy of isolation. This is a great coup for American diplomacy and influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97607;Commodore Perry has returned from his mission to Japan with unfortunate news: they have chosen to defy his ultimatum and thumb their collective noses at our government. Should we back down now
column2: it will be a great blow to our prestige and our influence in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97608;We are being overwhelmed by the superior might of western armaments. Despite the loss of face
column2: we must consider offering the hated foreigners terms of our surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97609;We have formally concluded a treaty with the Japanese which will see our influence restored
column2: and our demands for their ports to be opened to our ships to be met. Additionally
column3: an indemnity will be placed upon their government to make up for the expense of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ war effort.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97610;Despite the overwhelming odds against them
column2: the Japanese have refused our generous offer of surrender.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97615;'Revere the emperor and expel the barbarians!'\n\nThis is the slogan chanted by neo-confucian activists
column2: reacting to the Tokugawa shogunate's opening of Japan to foreigners. There have been growing reports of violence all over the country
column3: primarily against foreign visitors and statesmen but also against the shogunate itself. Each incident chips away at Tokugawa control over the daimyo and erodes relations with the western powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97616;There has been an incident in $PROVINCENAME$ where samurai
column2: acting under the political slogan of 'Sonno Joi'
column3: have committed violence against foreigners conducting business in $STATENAME$. The incident has affected the Tokugawa shogunate's relations with foreign powers
column4: as well as incited locals into riot.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: is a challenge to the shogunate's power
column4: and may serve to further incite rebellion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Imperial Court has issued an edict to expel the foreign barbarians present in Japan. This runs in contravention to the traditional role of the Emperor as a figurehead
column3: and is a challenge to the shogunate's power. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan must decide whether it supports the Emperor's edict or quietly opposes it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the 13th shogun of Japan
column3: has died childless. This has begun a struggle within the bakufu to select a replacement. The southern tozama daimyo wish to see Tokugawa Yoshinobu become shogun
column4: while the fudai daimyo and shogunate officials are more in favor of Tokugawa Iemochi-- even though he is still but a child. It seems certain that
column5: no matter which candidate is victorious
column6: the disaffected daimyo will see this as a loss of power and make trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97621;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Yoshinobu as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the tozama daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the tozama will be permitted more influence within the shogunate.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the relatives and close allies of the Tokugawa clan
column3: supported the appointment of young Iemochi as the new shogun following Iesada's death
column4: instead the leader of the bakufu will be Yoshinobu... a candidate favored by the outsider tozama daimyo. The fudai are growing increasingly alarmed at the insidious influence of the tozama
column5: and there is a stirring sentiment that perhaps the time has come for a grander change.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97623;Pandering once again to the fudai daimyo
column2: all relatives and close allies within the bakufu
column3: the child Iemochi has been appointed shogun-- instead of the more sensible candidate chosen by the tozama. It is becoming increasingly clear that a larger change is necessary. Perhaps the time has come for the Emperor to rule Japan
column4: a single leader to bring the nation into this new era?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97624;The shogunate has taken a step in the right direction and appointed Tokugawa Iemochi as the new leader of the bakufu following the death of Iesada. This was always the preferred choice of the fudai daimyo
column2: and perhaps it is a sign that the bakufu is not only willing to do what it must to keep Japan strong but also a sign that the outsider tozama will have their influence in the bakufu kept to a minimum.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97625;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point. Many are urging that a policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court-- may be required.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97626;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: and thus the bakufu has begun a compromise policy of Kobu Gattai-- a union of the bakufu and the imperial court. Some are seeing this as a sign of further weakness.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97627;The shogun's Chief Minister has been assassinated by ronin samurai outside the very gates of Edo castle! Though the ronin were either cut down or committed seppuku
column2: a manifesto found on their bodies makes it clear their act was a reaction to the recent purge instigated by the Chief Minister against agitators within the shogunate. This is a clear sign that upheaval against the bakufu has reached an unacceptable point
column3: yet the shogunate refuses to compromise with the imperial court. Many are certain this will only speed up the coming conflict.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97630;There are some who believe that Emperor Komei was assassinated-- delivered a handkerchief laced with smallpox
column2: perhaps by radicals who fear the possibility of compromise between the bakufu and the imperial court. No matter the truth
column3: the death of the Emperor has placed the young Emperor Meiji upon the imperial throne and eliminated any chance of compromise.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97635;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. Officials within the bakufu are urging that we seek allies among either the outsider tozama or the traditional fudai
column3: to strengthen the shogunate's position. Approaching one means angering the other
column4: of course
column5: but it appears we have little choice.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97636;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the outsider tozama
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. If so
column4: this compounds injury with insult.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97637;There is a growing restlessness among the daimyo
column2: with some whispering that the Tokugawa shogunate has grown weak and is unable to deal with the encroachment of foreign powers. We have received word that the shogunate has consulted with the fudai daimyo
column3: perhaps seeking new allies. This is hardly unexpected
column4: though the tozama agree this makes it clear that the shogunate is not the future of Japan.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97640;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ must make a decision: do we throw in our support with the imperial court
column2: or do we uphold our duty and support the shogun?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97641;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have seized control of the palace at Kyoto and declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over Japan. Word has it they have recruited fellow daimyo to stand with them in this traitorous war. We must issue a call to our allies and move at once!\n\n§RNOTE: To win this war
column2: you must occupy Kyoto and the rebellion leader's capital. You must not allow Edo to become occupied
column3: and you cannot White Peace. If you White Peace

column1: EVTDESC97642;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. We have little choice
column2: as they have forced our hand. Either we rise up against the Shogun now
column3: or the Shogun will assume we are behind the rebellion even if we are not. The time has come to fight!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97645;The Edo palace has been occupied
column2: and our loyal daimyo are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Emperor his victory. There is a place for the Tokugawa within the new order.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97646;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan forces have marched triumphantly into Edo
column2: and the Tokugawa shogunate has agreed to a permanent peace. For the first time since before the Sengoku
column3: the Imperial Court now rules Japan once again. Victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97647;Emperor Meiji has been restored to rule over Japan. An imperial messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our willing allegiance to the Emperor.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME97648;A New Capital in the East?;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97648;While Kyoto has long been the capital of Japan
column2: and home to the Imperial Court
column3: the city of Edo has become the de facto capital-- for centuries it has been the center of shogunate power
column4: as well as a cultural and administrative center. The Emperor will need to decide whether the court should move to Edo and create a new capital... or remain in Kyoto and revitalize it instead.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97650;The Imperial palace at Kyoto has been occupied
column2: and our daimyo allies are on the retreat. Our advisors tell us that our only option is to lay down our arms and allow the Shogun his victory. If we are fortunate
column3: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ clan will not be wiped out by this unfortunate turn of events.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97651;Tokugawa clan forces have marched triumphantly into Kyoto
column2: and the traitor daimyos have agreed to a permanent peace. The Bakumatsu has ended with the shogunate in control once again-- victory is ours!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97652;The Tokugawa shogunate has once again asserted control over Japan. A bakufu messenger has arrived at the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ palace in $CAPITAL$ to demand our submission to direct rule from Edo.;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC97605;More 'black ships' have appeared off our shores
column2: these ones commanded by an American named Commodore Matthew Perry. The ill-tempered westerner is demanding an end to the Japanese policy of Sokoku-- specifically trading rights in several ports
column3: extraterritoriality for American sailors and protection for their shipwrecks. At first he demanded to negotiate with the Emperor
column4: but that is impossible. Thus it falls to the Shogun to either agree to his demands
column5: risking the appearance of weakness
column6: or refuse and bring the wrath of the Americans upon us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97660;With the ascension of Emperor Taisho
column2: whose poor health has prompted a shift in political power from Japan's old guard to the Imperial Diet
column3: democratic parties are beginning to see their influence spread throughout the country. Though democratic tradition is not deeply rooted
column4: the idea of enfranchisement as a right of the individual Japanese citizen has become far more broadly accepted. Students
column5: university professors and journalists inspired by Western schools of thought have organized public demonstrations to demand new reforms.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97665;A growing dissatisfaction among the former samurai with the abolition of the han system and the resulting reduction in their personal prestige has crystallized in a rebellion. Led by one of the most prestigious samurai leaders of the former Satsuma Domain
column2: Saigo Takamori
column3: the rebellion has attracted a large number of followers and will be a severe challenge for the Japanese government to deal with.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97670;The islands of Sakhalin and the Kurils are a natural extension of our holdings on Hokkaido
column2: and we must seek to claim these places before the Russians do so first.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97673;$COUNTRY$ has followed a militaristic path until now
column2: determined to set ourselves against our neighbours in the interest of security-- while risking that security with dangerous wars. The new $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has determined that this must change. We must follow a path of progress
column3: and instead devote outselves to technology and westernization if we are to remain free and whole.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97674;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has followed a policy of progress and westernization until now
column2: hoping that advancing $COUNTRY$ to match the Western powers would keep us safe. We now see this is in error
column3: and that only by an aggressive expansion of our borders can we hope to maintain the security of $COUNTRY$ proper.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97675;The Chinese have fallen into warring factions
column2: all but crumbling their power and leaving us an advantage we would be fools not to exploit. The Line of Advantage policy dictates that we should strike
column3: and strike soon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the hated Japanese have decided to strike at us and take control of our government. They shall find us a difficult target!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97677;Our nation's policy of the Line of Advantage dictates that we must expand our borders if we are to maintain security. Naturally
column2: our most vulnerable point lies in neighbouring Korea. They must either be brought under our direct control or made into a vassal if $COUNTRY$ is to be kept safe. Already $COUNTRY_ADJ$ generals are clamoring for war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97678;The recent murder of Japanese sailors off the coast of Formosa has given rise to a question within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government: should we use this excuse to step in and wrest control of the southern island? The Line of Advantage is clear
column2: dictating that the land would be invaluable to our goals. But are we willing to risk such a war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97679;After the recent murders of a number of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ sailors off the coast of Formosa
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has delivered a demand: turn over the island
column3: for the sake of their security
column4: or it shall be war between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY$. We know this is just an excuse for their militarist expansion... but can we stand up against their might?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC150000;Unrest in our colonies has risen to unprecedented levels! With the eyes of the world now upon us
column2: every action we take to suppress our colonial subjects will trigger international repercussions. Unless we want to become the laughingstock of the civilised world it would seem like we will either have to make compromises or grant our colonies independence.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA150000;Surely it can't be that bad!;;;;;;x
EVTDESC150001;Egypt has nationalised the Suez Canal
column2: if we do not act we risk losing this vital imperial asset along with much prestige.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB150001;We shall take it back by force!;;;;;;x
EVTDESC150002;The era of colonial exploitation is coming to an end in $COUNTRY$. Our colonial days shall never be forgotten even so
column2: for good and for worse.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA150002;Well we had a good run at it anyway;;;;;;x
EVTDESC150010;Angered by what they see as Western decadence
column2: imperialism and oppression of muslims worldwide
column3: many of our citizens are joining organisations determined to fight Western influence and replace it with the strictest islamic code of conduct. They also believe in the restoration of the old islamic caliphate and its eventual expansion.;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC170000;Technological advances have opened up a new frontier - Space. Scientists from all major nations are now putting into practice plans to send national assets into orbit in order for their country to be the first to reap the benefits from these technologies. The most ambitious plan being a manned mission to the moon and back
column2: which would strenghten our place in the world as well as providing valuable scientific data for our researchers.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA170000;We choose to go to the Moon!;;;;;;x
EVTDESC170001;The spacecraft designed to send $COUNTRY_ADJ$ astronauts to the moon has exploded on launch. An investigation into the disaster shows faulty equipment was to blame.;;;;;;x
EVTDESC170002;An explosion in our spacecraft bound to the Moon led to its disintegration
column2: the crew was left to die a lonely death in the void of space.;;;;;;x
let's concentrate on Earthly matters;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME170003;$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Man First On The Moon!;;;;;;x
EVTDESC170003;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ space agency has successfully landed the first man on the moon
column2: a man from $COUNTRY$!;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA170003;That's one small step for a man
column2: one giant leap for mankind;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC170004;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ organisations have announced today that they have successfully permanently settled the first men on the Moon. The Moon
column2: with its significantly lower gravity
column3: lack of atmosphere and unique geological features
column4: could prove invaluable to our scientists
column5: and its dusty soil is said to hide many rare resources. Although time only will tell whether the enterprise was worth it
column6: the so-called 'space colonists' involved are said to be excited and determined to make it so
column7: this is undoubtedly an historic moment!;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC170005;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has announced today that $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ organisations have permanently settled the first men on the Moon in what is described as an "Economic and Scientific Mission". The Moon
column2: with its significantly lower gravity than Earth
column3: lack of atmosphere and unique geological features
column4: could prove invaluable to $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ scientists
column5: and its dusty soil is said to hide many rare resources. Although time only will tell whether the enterprise was worth it
column6: the so-called 'space colonists' involved are said to be excited and determined to make it so
column7: this is undoubtedly an historic moment!;;;;;;x

column2: with its low gravity
column3: thin atmosphere
column4: unique geological features and the possibility of ancient life
column5: could prove invaluable to our scientists. And its red earth is thought to hide many rare resources. Although time only will tell whether the enterprise was worth it
column6: the so-called 'space colonists' involved are said to be excited and determined to make it so

EVTDESC170010;Vague reports of a major incident have reached us from our colony on the moon. Many colonists are reported to have died and many more are wounded. Most of our scientists on Earth suspect an asteroid strike or equipment failure to be the cause.;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA170010;Send emergency teams to assess the damage and assist the colony;;;;;;x

EVTDESC170011;Vague reports of a major incident have reached us from our colony on Mars. Many colonists are reported to have died and many more are wounded. Most of our scientists on Earth suspect a major storm
column2: marsquake or equipment failure to be the cause.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA170011;Send emergency teams to assess the damage and assist the colony;;;;;;x

EVTDESC170012;When a foreigner from another nearby lunar colony was caught wandering in the halls of the life support chamber tensions escalated quickly. Accusations thrown to and fro put the two tightly-knit communities against each other and resulted in the death of a young $COUNTRY_ADJ$ woman. She has now become a martyr and many
column2: including our colonists
column3: are openly calling for the foreign power to be expelled from the Moon.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC170013;When a foreigner from another nearby Martian colony was caught wandering in the halls of the life support chamber tensions escalated quickly. Accusations thrown to and fro put the two tightly-knit communities against each other and resulted in the death of a young $COUNTRY_ADJ$ woman. She has now become a martyr and many
column2: including our colonists
column3: are openly calling for the foreign power to be expelled from Mars.;;;;;;x

column2: once said to be the jewel in the crown of our empire
column3: has now been lost. Is this the beginning of the end for the British Empire?";;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200000;Following the rise of the recent Indian independence movement led by Mahatma Gandhi the Mohammedian people of India have started to campaign for a country of their own should India be declared a free nation. Naturally the nation would be carved out of our North-Western Indian posessions as it is the region with the largest concentration of Moslems. The movement has become widespread and gained in radicalism over the years
column2: should we not promise them their nation we can expect an increase in tensions between the Moslem Indians and their Hindu neighbours.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC200001;Mahatma Gandhi has gained much popularity amongst his fellow Indians through his practice of peaceful civil disobedience and is becoming more and more of a problem. His aim is to expel $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces out of India and form an independent nation. What shall we do with him?;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA200001;Imprison him and deal with the dissenters;;;;;;x

column2: under the leadership of Gandhi
column3: have found novel ways to pester us. While they will not repeat the mistakes of their sepoy forebears and openly challenge our might
column4: they have started to deny our right to rule over them by standing completely still and not responding to commands from their $COUNTRY_ADJ$ superiors no matter how much pressure is applied. This will undoubtedly affect production.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC200010;The issue has divided the nation in recent months. What shall be the government's position?;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;
EVTOPTC200010;This is hardly important is it?;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column2: a Jewish Movement advocating a 'return' of Jews to their ancestral homeland
column3: has grown in popularity over the years and many Jewish organisations are now offering to send migrants there. It is said that the rise of zionism is partly due to increasing intolerance by nationalist elements in European nations
column4: who view Jews as profiteering internationalists due to their nomadic nature and close ties with the banking profession.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column2: an hebrew word meaning 'ascent'. According to them God has promised the land to the Jewish people and they are merely returning to their home country.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column2: they resent the nationalist zionist cause and have responded with their own national claim on Palestine. It is feared that this conflict could escalate into a full-blown civil war.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC200074;The native Americans of Northern Quebec object to the inclusion of their ancestral homelands into our new nation and wish to remain part of Canada. They have cited various territorial treaties entered with British Kings in colonial times as evidence that their lands cannot be claimed by Quebec separatists.;;;;;;x
EVTDESC200075;Recent developments leave no doubts in anyone's mind
column2: $COUNTRY$ has truly become a world superpower. Our nation now shines like no other and as such we are expected to set an example for the world.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC200076;Despite our best efforts it seems like our time as a world superpower has come to an end.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

Mississipi called Elvis Aaron Presley has been catapulted to fame thanks to his innovative style and music. rumours of inadequate relations with a White House intern

column1: EVTDESC200604;It has been revealed that our administration is wire-tapping opponents in order to blackmail them. Following calls for his impeachment President Nixon had no choice but to resign.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC200605;Left-wing activists and the Afro-American community in this country are protesting after neighbourhood watch George Zimmerman
column2: who killed a 17-year old black man apparently in self-defense was acquitted in court today. They claim the acquital shows that racism is still alive in $COUNTRY$ and will not back down until Zimmerman is sent to prison. The case has the potential to cause riots all over the nation.;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;

column2: or WHO. It is hoped that in years to come the agency will be able to prevent pandemics by using the combined resources of the world and having unrestricted access to all corners of the planet.;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC400001;With the people behind us we are now firmly in control of this new American nation. While there is much talk about a Republic based on the values of the enlightenment
column2: and indeed Thomas Jefferson has written the draft of a declaration stating just that
column3: there is nothing preventing us from following a different path.;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC400002;$MONARCHTITLE$! Your majesty's governor of Massachussets reports that three East India Company tea ships
column2: the Dartmouth
column3: the Eleanor and the Beaver have been savagely attacked by rebellious colonists in Boston. The rebels
column4: calling themselves 'sons of liberty' and disguised as Indians under the leadership of Samuel Adams
column5: forcibly made their way aboard the ships and proceeded to throw overboard thousands of pounds worth of tea! All this apparently in protest of our recent Tea Act. What shall we do?;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC400005;Multiple disputes over the ownership of frontier territories between $COUNTRY_ADJ$ colonies and those of a foreign power have resulted in an increasingly tense climate. We would surely be justified should we choose to take action against these foreign colonists
column2: although some in our court suggest we should ease the tensions by finding a compromise so as to avoid an armed conflict.;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC401002;The Holy Roman Empire is a largely decentralised organisation made up of many states dating back to the coronation of Charlemagne on Christmas day of the year 800. The emperor is chosen from amongst other rulers by his fellow prince electors. Our advisors are wisely reminding us that we are part of it.;;;;;;x;;
EVTDESC401003;The Scots have become wary of the increasing Anglican influence North of the border and are now in open rebellion. We risk losing control over Scotland if we do not act.;;;;;;x;;

EVTDESC401011;The natives in $PROVINCENAME$ are dying in great numbers due to a terrible disease. The fact that they insist they have never endured such a calamity before our arrival seems to suggest we may have brought it with us from Europe. We are powerless to stop it
column2: but attempts to alleviate their sufferings may help soothe the tensions between them and our colonists.;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC401013;Cowardly natives have attacked our colony in $PROVINCENAME$ and killed many of our subjects
column2: sparing neither women nor children. Some men from the neighbouring colonies and abled survivors have banded together and are ready to pursue the raiders into their territory should we choose to retaliate.;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC401014;Differences between Catholics and Protestants have erupted today in $PROVINCENAME$ resulting in a number of deaths and a tense stalemate between the two sides. Catholics
column2: who are the minority
column3: vow to continue fighting as long as their demands are not met.;;;;;;x;;

column1: EVTDESC402010;The mediatization brought about a massive change to the political map of Germany. Literally hundreds of states were eliminated
column2: with only around forty surviving. A number of the surviving states made significant territorial gains (most notably Baden
column3: Bavaria
column4: and Hesse-Darmstadt); and Baden
column5: Hesse-Kassel
column6: and Württemberg gained status by being made electorates (to replace three that had been lost in the changes). Of the imperial cities
column7: only Augsburg
column8: Bremen
column9: Frankfurt am Main
column10: Hamburg
column12: and Nuremberg survived as independent entities.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC402040;The fourth Peace of Pressburg was signed on 26 December 1805 between France and Austria as a consequence of the Austrian defeats by France at Ulm and Austerlitz. Beyond the clauses establishing "peace and amity" and the Austrian withdrawal from the Third Coalition
column2: the treaty also took substantial European territories from Austria. The gains of the previous treaties of Campo Formio and Lunéville were reiterated and Austrian holdings in Italy and Bavaria were ceded to France. Certain Austrian holdings in Germany were passed to French allies: the King of Bavaria
column3: the King of Württemberg
column4: and the Elector of Baden. The most notable territorial exchanges concerned the Tyrol and Vorarlberg which went to Bavaria
column5: and Venetia
column6: Istria
column7: and Dalmatia which were incorporated in the Kingdom of Italy
column8: of which Napoleon had become king earlier that year. Augsburg was ceded to Bavaria. As a minor compensation
column9: Austria received the Electorate of Salzburg.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC402050;The Empire was formally dissolved on 6 August 1806
column2: when the last Holy Roman Emperor Francis II abdicated
column3: following a military defeat by the French under Napoleon at Austerlitz (see Treaty of Pressburg). Napoleon reorganized much of the Empire into the Confederation of the Rhine
column4: a French satellite. Francis' House of Habsburg-Lorraine survived the demise of the Empire
column5: continuing to reign as Emperors of Austria and Kings of Hungary until the Habsburg empire's final dissolution in 1918 in the aftermath of World War I.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA402050;This is not the way it should have ended.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column3: the Emperor remains formally in power.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC402080;The Treaties of Tilsit were two agreements signed by Napoleon I of France in the town of Tilsit in July
column2: 1807 in the aftermath of his victory at Friedland. The first was signed on 7 July
column3: between Tsar Alexander I of Russia and Napoleon I of France
column4: when they met on a raft in the middle of the Neman River. The second was signed with Prussia on 9 July. The treaties was made at the expense of the Prussian king
column5: who had already agreed to a truce on 25 June after the Grande Armée had pursued him to the easternmost frontier of his realm
column6: and in Tilsit ceded about half of his pre-war territories.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but it seems to be a fair peace
column3: at least for us. The Emperor of the French
column4: offert us a "light peace"
column5: if we give him free hand in Prussia and become a part of the "Continental Blockade";;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC500000;The world trade centre in our biggest city has this morning been the object of the worst and most extensive attack carried out on $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soil by terrorists. Hundreds are dead and many more are missing
column2: the city will take months before fully recovering and it is feared that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people will never fully recover from the shock
column3: this undoubtedly marks the beginning of a new era in international affairs. The suspected leader of the attack
column4: a member of a wealthy arabic family
column5: has reportedly fled to Afghanistan where islamic militants offered him refuge. Conservative elements in our nation call for swift and indiscriminate action against the suspects and a tightening of nation-wide security
column6: while the opposition urges caution in our response to these acts.;x;;;;;;;;;

column1: EVTDESC999000;The intensive election campaign has reached the boiling point in $COUNTRY$
column2: where a fierce trade policy debate pits the friends of free trade against the pals of protectionism in a rough rumble-and-tumble to determine the future of our nation's traders. Free-traders argue that goods must be allowed to freely cross all borders
column3: while protectionists argue that our nation's fragile industries need protection from dangerous foreign competition threatening to undo them. Which path will $COUNTRY$ tread
column4: as it decides on: Free trade
column5: or Protectionism? We report
column6: you decide.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999000;Our trade must be protected from destructive foreign competition!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and let the chips fall where they may!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC999000;Freedom and liberty of trade shall not perish from this Earth!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999020;The remaining elections of $YEAR$ where unusually quite. The political parties had no important issues to talk about and the whole election passed without any significant debates or events.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA999020;There shall be peace and quite in our time.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999021;The elections of $YEAR$ where unusually violent. Only a few days after the campaigns had started
column2: the first incidents happened. Strikes occured in several large factories
column3: streetfighting started in most major cities. Paramilitary groups threatened voters of opposing ideologies
column4: radicals staged attacks on political enemies. The police worked tirelessly to get the situation under control
column5: but it looked like $COUNTRY$ was in for a hot election.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999022;The tensions from the current election campaigns have escalated and disorder is spreading fast in $COUNTRY$. We have to do something! We can either act immediately or wait a few more days until some of the steam has vented. Or we make a cunning plan and blame one of the more radical parties. So
column2: what should we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999022;Take control of the situation NOW!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB999022;Let them lose some steam and act LATER!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC999022;Blame the Liberals and try to ban them from the election!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999040;'Why should only the rich be allowed to vote? We also pay taxes
column2: so why shouldn't we have something to say in politics?' \n The industrial revolution has empowered the middle class. More and more businessmen are making more and more money. It seems only natural that they demand voting rights.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999040;They are right - support their reform.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB999040;Voting rights for the middle class? Nay!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC999040;A reform is long past due - issue a new voting right.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we even pay way higher taxes then they do! Still
column3: their votes are worth more than ours - I ask you: is that really fair?' \n While being allowed to vote
column4: the middle class feels diminished by the current weighted voting rights. Maybe we should issue a reform to make all their votes equal?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTC999041;We shall do this right away!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999042;'Why is everyone trying to keep us out of politics? Because we are uneducated? They call us minors
column2: but that is a lie! Our sweet and toil has brought the nation forward! We have waited long enough - now we demand our just due!' \n It looks like the poor finally demand voting rights. Maybe we should grant them a voice?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999043;'We hold these truths to be self-evident
column2: that all men are created equal
column3: that they are endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable Rights
column4: that among these are Life
column5: Liberty
column6: and the Pursuit of Happiness. That to secure these rights
column7: Governments are instituted among Men
column8: deriving their just powers from the consent of the governed' \n - Thomas Jefferson;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB999043;Enough is enough! Stop that nonsense!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC999043;Equal votes for equal chances - NOW!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: again and again. Why? Because I am a proud citizen who will speak the truth! I don't believe that the ruling party will save us. And my weapon is logic
column3: but theirs is the stick.';;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999045;'Why are they allowed to change the rules during an election? Drawing random borders to scatter those who won't vote for them is not fair. It is fraud
column2: I tell you! They divided our district between four others
column3: because they knew how we would vote. FRAUD! That's what it is

column2: we have to do something.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB999045;Want me to play the world's smallest violin?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999046;'Why does everyone stare at me when I make my vote? Do they really need to know? It is not like I am committing a crime or something
column2: I simply want to vote in peace. Without having half of the polling station looking at me

column1: EVTOPTA999046;I guess some privacy would be in order.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999047;The socialists have started a countrywide drive for social reforms in $COUNTRY$. Their methods are new and the law about them is rather ambiguous. Should we allow them to continue their campaign?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999048;Socialists and communists have started a countrywide drive for social reforms in $COUNTRY$. Their methods are new and the law about them is rather ambiguous. Should we allow them to continue their campaign?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but liberals and socialists are still arguing about the current state of affairs. Unemployment is a problem
column3: but both sides have decisive arguments for what they think has to be done.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999050;Unemployment is still an important issue in $COUNTRY$
column2: but all our recent attempts to crate new jobs have failed. During the election of $YEAR$
column3: communists and fascists argued that their dogma is the only one that will give work to the people.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999100;Our recent victories in the current war have driven our population towards a more aggressive war agenda.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999101;Our recent defeats in the current war have made our population weary. They want peace - at any price.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999102;Everything was normal in the barracks of $CAPITAL$. The lottery had designated the new men that were to be drafted into the army. Suddenly: Outrage! Thousands of people filling the streets
column2: protesting against the current conscription laws and the war itself. Police dispersed the crowd
column3: but they said they will be back. What shall we do?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999102;Arrest the troublemakers and contiue the drafts.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB999102;They have a point - postpone the drafts for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999103;This is not only our war son
column2:
it is your war too! 
 Join the army! Fight for your country! 
 It is a patriot's duty! 
 BE A PATRIOT!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999104;The war was over - the results devestating. Had we won? Had we lost? No one could really tell. \n All we knew was: There should be no war
column2: nevermore. We have paid our price - now let us make the world a better place. A safe place for our children. \n  Let the doves fly to our neighbours to bring them the message of a new dawn
column3: let us tell them: the day of everlasting peace has arrived!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999105;They have taken our land. Our rightful soil. It rightfully belongs to us - and if they won't give it to us
column2: we shall take it by force!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB999105;This piece of land isn't worth the trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999106;They have taken our land. Our rightful soil. It rightfully belongs to us - and if they won't give it to us
column2: we shall take it by force! And Fascism will lead the way - the way to victory!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB999106;This piece of land isn't worth the trouble.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999107;The general stood next to the door of the garrison
column2: the attack came unexpected. A soldier had grabbed a pistol and fired several shots at him
column3: the general had no chance. The guards rushed to aid him
column4: shot the attacker
column5: but it was too late. \n But what seemed to be pointless murder soon turned out to be some sort of desperate retaliation. Something is wrong in our miliary
column6: truth be told: A lot is wrong. But who is to blame?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999110;$YEAR$ was a great year. In fact
column2: it was the best year of the last decade. The weather was marvelous
column3: the harvest a huge success. Our economy was booming and it seems everyone had gotten their share. The people are happy and content - at least for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999111;We can't pay these taxes! We are already starving
column2: how much more shall we pay? \n It seems that our taxation is too heavy for the poor. They cannot cope with this burden - we must do something
column3: or these tax protests will spread all over the country!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999112;How much more shall we pay? Why can't a hard working man keep the fruit of his work? \n It seems that our taxation is too heavy for the middle class. They cannot cope with this burden - we must do something
column2: or these tax protests will spread all over the country!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999113;It is a joke! I can barely pay upkeep for my business
column2: let alone pay for my house. If this continues
column3: I will live under a bridge by next month! \n It seems that our taxation is too heavy for the rich. They cannot cope with this burden - we must do something
column4: or these tax protests will spread all over the country!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999114;The people are outraged by the current tax levels. Frustration has turned into violence and people are protesting on the street. Police has tried to remove them by force
column2: but it seems that wide parts of the population have solidarized with them! We must do something!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999114;As I said: We will think about something.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME999120;The Old Order Is In Danger!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999120;The communists have gained quite some influence in our country. We must be vigilant
column2: since this can turn into a dangeous situation for our government. You know about their dreams of the communist utopia - if we let this go on
column3: they might want to lay the foundation it in $COUNTRY$...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999120;We will think of some countermeasures.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME999121;The Old Order Is In Danger!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999121;The fascists have gained quite some influence in our country. We must be vigilant
column2: since this can turn into a dangeous situation for our government. You know about their dreams of a fascist state - if we let this go on
column3: the masses might join their cause!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999121;We will think of some countermeasures.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTNAME999122;The New Order Is In Danger!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999122;Reactionaries have gained more and more influence lately. People are growing tired of all the new things we have brought to $COUNTRY$. We should start to improve the conditions
column2: or they will force us to do things 'the old way'.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999122;We will think of some countermeasures.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC999123;The recent years have made the rich ever richer - and with money comes power. We must be vigilant
column2: because these rich individuals do not only want money - they also want the power. If we allow them to gain more support from the population
column3: the situation could soon turn sour for us...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999123;We will think of some countermeasures.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999124;We have failed. There are red flags are everywhere. The people have given up trust and hope in the current government. And the communists have made their final move and are marching for the $CAPITAL$. If we mobilize the remaining loyal soldiers we might have a chance
column2: but are we really willing to pay this price?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA999124;We will never surrender! Use all means to fight them back!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB999124;We will not spill the blood of our people. Step down and let them take over.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC999130;A whisper goes around the world:\n Worker
column2:
don't you hear it?
 These are the voices of war ministers:
 Worker don't you hear them?
 The whispering comes from all continents:
 Mobilization against the revolution!
 Workers
column3: peasants
column4: Arm yourselves
column5:
Arm yourselves with guns.
 Set all Hearts on Fire!
 Plant your Red banners of Labor
 On every ramp
column6:
on every factory.
 Rising from the ruins
 Of the old society
 The socialist World Republic!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999131;We have won! \n Nobody thought we had a chance
column2: but our great leader has overcome them all! \n The power is ours - and from this day on
column3: $COUNTRY$ will rise to bring the world a new order! \n The third way is victorious!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999132;The royal family had lost it's power for far too long. Now it is restored - and the new king shall bestow his grace upon $COUNTRY$ once more!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: your brand new state newspaper
column3: and I am Juanito
column4: your new favorite news article writer! \n For today's headliner
column5:
we have the amazing story of El Presidente and his way to power! 
 It all started back in... [...] 

 And remember folks: Don't read this so called ""newspaper"" from Betty Boom - it is filled with anti-patriotic lies against our great El Presidente!";;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC999134;Money makes right - and we have proven it once and for all! Finally we can have our rightful taste of the sweet fruits of power. \n Jeeves
column2: bring us  some wine so we can celebrate this occasion.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
France is now at our mercy!;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB1000000;Take Northern France and form a puppet government to rule over Southern France and its colonies;;;;;;x
EVTDESC1000002;Although Churchill promised the British Empire would fight on
column2: in reality once London fell there was little resistance overseas. The island of Great Britain is now at our mercy and the British will lose their Empire to local native governments should we choose to annex it. Alternatively we can offer the British crown to Edward VIII
column3: a Royal Nazi sympathiser. The former Royal family having fled to Canada.;;;;;;x

column2: the Belgian government has fled into exile and Belgium is now at our mercy. What shall we do?;;;;;;x
the Dutch government has fled into exile and the Netherlands are now at our mercy. What shall we do?;;;;;;x
its government has fled into exile and the country is now at our mercy. What shall we do?;;;;;;x
We have occupied Moscow and the Russian leadership has formally surrendered. This vast country is now at our mercy!;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC4088789;The masses of the planet look in awe and fear as the Russian government declares the Federation dead and the USSR returned. Neighboring governments have quickly begun militarizing the border as it appears that the Cold War may be coming back to us.;;;;;;x

column1: desc_ev_20000006;The Year of Three Popes is a common reference to a year when the College of Cardinals of the Catholic Church are required to elect two new popes within the same calendar year. Such a year generally occurs when a newly elected pope dies or resigns very early into his papacy. This results in the Catholic Church being led by three different popes during the same calendar year.;;;;;;x;;

in earlier centuries often called the Gunpowder Treason Plot or the Jesuit Treason
column3: was a failed assassination attempt against King James I of England and VI of Scotland by a group of provincial English Catholics led by Robert Catesby. The plan was to blow up the House of Lords during the State Opening of England's Parliament on 5 November 1605. The plot was revealed to the authorities in an anonymous letter sent to William Parker
column4: 4th Baron Monteagle
column5: on 26 October 1605. During a search of the House of Lords at about midnight on 4 November 1605
column6: Fawkes was discovered guarding 36 barrels of gunpowder?enough to reduce the House of Lords to rubble?and arrested. Most of the conspirators fled from London as they learned of the plot's discovery
column7: trying to enlist support along the way.;;;;;;x;;

column8: known as St George's Cross)
column9: and the flag of Scotland (a white saltire on a blue background
column10: known as the Saltire or St Andrew's Cross)

column13: although the Union remained a personal one.";;;;;;x;;
